1.caption_en:
Infographic summarizing three levels of ecosystem thinking — Portfolio (multi-market), Market (single market), and Platform (individual business) — with descriptions, suggested application contexts, and visual diagrams showing concentric market/ platform relationships.

{
  "title": "The three levels of ecosystem thinking and when to apply them",
  "levels": [
    {
      "id": "L1",
      "name": "Portfolio Level (Multi-Market)",
      "description": "Especially bigger corporates have built over time a big portfolio of different businesses - organized by business units - covering multiple different markets. Each segment represents a specific market ecosystem; this perspective helps you to align company-wide portfolios.",
      "when_to_apply": "You are a big corporate / super platform and you want a holistic strategy for your business model portfolio.",
      "examples": [
        "BASF",
        "Bosch",
        "Apple",
        "Insurance companies"
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": "L2",
      "name": "(Single) Market Level",
      "description": "The market level perspective dives deeper into the understanding of a selected market. It helps to identify key players in the market as well as critical control points and new growth opportunities in this area.",
      "when_to_apply": "You want to understand and explore a specific market ecosystem with its players, control points and growth opportunities.",
      "notes": "Relevant for Startups and Corporates to create a market understanding."
    },
    {
      "id": "L3",
      "name": "Platform Level (Individual Business)",
      "description": "This level helps you to understand the key users (consumers, producers, partners) of your platform business. It is very business/venture oriented and helps dedicated startup teams to make decisions and unlock network effects.",
      "when_to_apply": "You plan to build and scale a platform business and want to understand the ecosystem of users.",
      "notes": "Relevant for platform ventures."
    }
  ],
  "visual_summary": {
    "layout": "Left: three concentric circular diagrams (top = portfolio slice view, middle = market ring with directional arrows, bottom = magnified platform diagram); Center: level headings and explanatory text; Right: 'When to apply?' guidance for each level.",
    "diagram_labels": [
      "Entertainment",
      "Mobility",
      "Healthcare",
      "Work",
      "Manufacturing",
      "Transport",
      "Trip Planning",
      "Stay",
      "Maintenance"
    ],
    "diagram_details": "Bottom magnified diagram shows a central circle labeled 'Platform' surrounded by colored icon circles representing users/roles/features.",
    "color_palette": [
      "teal",
      "orange",
      "gray"
    ]
  },
  "language": "English",
  "ocr_excerpt": "L1 - Portfolio Level (Multi-Market)... L2 - (Single) Market Level... L3 - Platform Level (Individual Business)... When to apply? You are a big corporate / super platform... You want to understand and explore a specific market ecosystem... You plan to build and scale a platform business..."
}
